decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The works to which this consent relates, must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this consent.
Condition : 2 - All new internal and external works, including works of making good, shall match the original work in both type, colour and dimensions of materials and in detailed execution.

Condition : 3 - This consent does not permit the demolition or dismantling of any part of the building, or its ancillary or curtilage structures, or the removal of any internal feature, floor, wall or ceiling surface, except in so far as the alterations and restoration hereby approved necessitate the removal of certain parts of the existing structures as specifically shown on the approved drawings.

Condition : 4 - Prior to the commencement of the development a description of the steps and works to be taken and carried out in relation to the repair and alteration of the existing timber frame of the buildings, including any additional elements to be inserted, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority in writing and the development shall thereafter be undertaken in accordance with the approved scheme

Condition : 5 - Any areas of external brickwork/masonry required to be created/replaced in accordance with the approved plans shall match the existing brickwork/masonry in colour and size, mortar colour and pointing and bonding detail.

Condition : 6 - No development shall take place until samples of the materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the dwellings hereby permitted have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details
Condition : 7 - The Sarah Trimmer Hall Sign and any associated features shall be retained except where otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.
description: Conversion of former St George's church and Sarah Trimmer Hall (grade II listed building) to 21 residential units, The proposal will involve partial demolition of the church (inc removal of chimney & stack and opening up the external walls) and demolition of the kitchen extension to Sarah Trimmer Hall
